english:
Skin to skin contact also known as kangaroo mother care is a technique of newborn care where babies are held chest-to-chest and skin-to-skin with a parent, typically their mother. Skin-to-skin contact is really good for the health of your baby, so you may want to try it in the future. 

I recommend that you spend at least one hour giving your baby skin-to-skin contact every day.

english:
For skin-to-skin contact, you and [child name] can spend quality time together on a daily basis. In fact, you can move around as you normally do while giving your child skin-to-skin contact.
     -->To get started, [child name] should be naked and your chest area should be bare. Rest [child name] upright on your chest so your skin is touching their face, chest, stomach, and arms. Their head should be turned to one side with their legs in a bent position. 
     -->Then, using a long piece of cloth, wrap [child name] against your chest so they are securely attached to your chest and won't move when you stand up. You can then wear your clothes over the cloth as normal. 
     -->You can stay in this position while you move around throughout the day and while sleeping at night. You only need to remove the child to change their diaper or give them a bath.

- Nutrition and health education
- Non- Formal Pre School Education (NEPSE)
- Supplementary Nutrition
- Growth monitoring and promotion
- Family welfare services

english: Children are more likely to attract flies, who cause a lot of diseases, when they are left with poor hygienic conditions, for instance, babies with runny nose or suffering from diarrhea. Moreover, babies inactive at the time of sleep or due to sickness also attract flies.Which is why when we talked previously, we emphasized on the importance of the baby being active. It is also very important that you do not practice open defecation nor do you teach your child to do so since the same is a cause of several diseases and other dangers.

english:
Unsafe and insufficient water supply and inadequate sanitation can compromise with the nutritional status of the child. People suffering from diarrhoea will not benefit fully from food because frequent stools prevents adequate absorption of nutrients. This can lead to malnutrition. 

Malnutrition affects all age groups, but it is especially common among those with inadequate access to health education and to clean water and good sanitation. Which is why it is extremely important that you take care of the sanitation and hygiene of not just [child name] but the entire family.

english: Diarrhea can be a sign of poor sanitation and hygiene ЁЯТз. You can take steps to prevent [child name] from getting diarrhea in the future by maintaining good sanitation and hygiene practices in your home.

english: Since diarrhea causes a loss of a lot of nutrients from the body of the child, it is important therefore that the same is replenished and compensated for. If the child has diarrhoea you should give them ORS and breastfeed the child more than usual to maintain their strength. ORS is available at any medical store and also with your AWW. Unless told by a doctor, you should not give them anything else, not even water!

english: An important component of maintaining sanitation and hygiene is the safe disposal of child feces since the same could be a breeding ground for flies, scavengers etc. While crawling or playing, children may put contaminated fingers, pica or fomites into their mouth. The safest way is to dispose the fecal matter in a toilet/latrine. All other methods are considered unsafe.  Problems associated with open defecation include serious respiratory issues, stomach illness (Typhoid and Jaundice), and malaria apart from diarrhea.

english: Hands should be washed on a regular basis, especially after using the washroom/changing the baby's diaper and before breastfeeding the child. Also, breasts should be wiped before breastfeeding the child. Using soap is a simple way to prevent the spread of infection and to keep you and your baby healthy ЁЯС╢ЁЯП╜. Keep the soap next to all water sources in your house to make it easier to wash your hands with soap every time. You should wash your hands for at least 20 seconds as advised by experts and dry them soon after because germs and bacteria spread easily in wet hands.

english:
Did you know that using a baby bottle to feed your child can actually make them sick? ЁЯН╝ Bottles are difficult to clean thoroughly, so germs can unintentionally be transferred to your child. It is recommended by many experts to stop all bottle feeding and switching to exclusive breastfeeding to avoid unintended sickness for your baby ЁЯд▒ЁЯП╜.

english: You should talk to AWW [AWW name] and get [child name]'s height and weight measured every month. It is extremely useful to find out the nutrition status of the child. english: This is known as a Growth Monitoring chart. Every month, your AWW based on the age of your child and their weight, marks a point of the graph. Over a period of time this takes shape of a line that will indicate the nutrition status of your child. The straight line shows the weight which increases as you go upwards and the flat line shows the age which increases as you move right.

RED- if the weight of your child is in this color, it means that (s)he is severely underweight and needs your immediate attention.

GREEN- if the weight of your child is in this color, it means that (s)he is currently in the appropriate weight range and you should continue taking good care of them and addressing their nutritional needs.

english:
Here are these facts!
-> Exclusive breastfeeding gives an infant the best chance to grow and stay healthy. 
-> It promotes production of more milk. 
-> Giving other food or fluids reduces the amount of breastmilk the child takes and, as a result, the amount of breastmilk the mother produces too is reduced. 
-> It decreases the transmission of germs from the environment. Water, feeding bottles, and utensils can pass germs to the young infant, even when they appear тАЬcleanтАЭ. The infant can become sick from the germs. 
-> It ensures that the milk the child gets is nutritious. Breast-milk contains all the nutrients that a baby needs during the first 6 months of life. Other foods or fluids may be too diluted or thin and can be contaminated. 
-> It provides enough iron. Iron contributes to the development of the brain, and helps the child focus attention. Iron from breast-milk is absorbed better. 
-> Young infants often have difficulty digesting animal milk. 
-> Animal milk may cause diarrhoea, rashes, or other allergies. Diarrhoea may continue and become persistent, leading to undernutrition

english: Expressing milk can be useful in several situations especially for feeding a young infant too weak to attach well to the nipple. Most newborns and young infants are strong enough to begin suckling right away. However, a baby may be low weight or for other reasons too weak to take enough milk. It may be necessary to express milk from the breast, and give it to the baby in small sips with a spoon or a small katori. Discourage the use of a feeding bottle. The use of the nipple on the feeding bottle will interfere with the newbornтАЩs suckling on the breast. This makes it more difficult for the newborn to breastfeed effectively. Also, a bottle and nipple are more difficult to clean well than a katori.

english:
┬╗ Mother should express the breast-milk herself 
┬╗ She should wash her hands well before expressing the milk and sit comfortably and hold a clean katori near her breast 
┬╗ She should put her thumb above the nipple and areola on the breast and her first finger below the nipple and areola. After this she should support her breast with other fingers. 
┬╗ The mother should then press the thumb and first finger towards the chest wall. She should press her breast behind the nipple and areola between her finger and thumb. Then she should press and release alternately. This should not hurt. 
┬╗ The milk may take some time to flow so do not be alarmed. After pressing several times the milk will begin to flow. The milk may come out in streams. Avoid squeezing the nipple since this may hurt. 
┬╗ Express one breast for about five minutes and wait for the milk flow to slow down. Then express the other side and then repeat both. It takes about 20-30 minutes to express the breast-milk especially during the first few days since only little milk may be produced.

The nutrition of mothers when they are breastfeeding their children is extremely important for both her health and the infantтАЩs health. With respect to the same, following are some areas I can provide you information on. Please press the number in front of the option you want know about: 
1. Why nutrition is important during lactation
2. How it affects the mother's health 
3. Benefits of breastfeeding to mothers 
4. How it affects breast milk  and its production  
5. How does it affect the health of the newborn and the child 
6. Nutritional deficiency and its management: Iron deficiency Anemia, Vitamin A deficiency, Lethargy and weakness/low productivity
7. Dietary recommendation during  lactation and how to increase nutrient value in homemade recipes.
8. Plan for a curative period between lactation and the next pregnancy. 
9. Other questions related to nutrition during lactation

english: The amount of breast milk produced depends mainly on how often and how effectively the baby sucks on the breast. If a mother temporarily produces less milk than the infant needs, the infant responds by suckling more vigorously, more frequently, or longer at each feeding. This stimulates greater milk production. If the mother is extremely malnourished, there would be inadequate production of breast milk. When the breastfeeding mother is undernourished, it is safer, easier, and less expensive to give her more food than to expose the infant to the risks associated with breast milk substitutes.

Both of these kinds are extremely important for the growth of a child.

english:
Iron deficiency anemia is a type of anemia that occurs when there is not enough iron to make hemoglobin in red blood cells. During pregnancy or lactation  when you don't have enough iron in your diet, you make fewer red blood cells, which is called  Iron deficiency anemia and itтАЩs a very common problem in india.
Management:
- Pregnant women received Iron/Folic Acid tablets from their AWC that is beneficial in removing iron deficiency from the motherтАЩs body. 
- By increasing iron-intake through locally available iron-rich sources like green vegetables, carrots and jaggery and black chana. These are easily available in your neighbourhood and you should increase their intake in your diet for your child to be healthy since they are dependent on your milk for their growth to the largest extent. Tea and caffeine reduce your bodyтАЩs ability to absorb iron so it need to be avoided. 
- Vitamin C, sources  which include citrus fruits like amla, orange, lemon etc. increase your bodyтАЩs capability to absorb iron. Also you should not take iron tablets with milk because that reduces the absorption of iron.

english:
WomenтАЩs vitamin A requirements are highest during lactation, about 1.5 times greater than for non-pregnant, non-lactating women. Vitamin A deficiency is a public health concern, the maternal dietary intake of vitamin A may not be sufficient to meet either the maternal nutritional requirements, or those of the breastfed infant (since the concentration of the same is low in the breast milk).Vitamin A plays an important role in vision, growth and physical development, and immune function, and a deficiency of vitamin A increases the risk of night blindness and other ocular conditions.
Management
- Local sources of vitamin A like green leafy vegetables especially spinach ,sweet potato,carrot,meat,whole milk, apricots etc.
- Any oral vitamin A supplement ( provided by your aww).

english: Most apparent signs of jaundice are yellowing of the skin and whites of the eyes. Jaundice can also cause color changes to bodily fluids, such as pale stools and dark urine.

english:
Mild cases of jaundice in children can sometimes go away without treatment.
- Ensure that your child has regular bowel movements which may also help the body to get rid faster of bilirubin. 
- maintain good hygiene and avoid  sharing of toys and other items from the infected child which can reduce the risk of conditions such as EBV.
- Two of the most common types of hepatitis are preventable by vaccines.so make sure to get your child immunised/vaccinated.
- Tips for avoiding constipation and establishing regular bowel movements include making sure your child:
> Is well-hydrated
> Has regular physical activity
> Gets enough dietary fiber, which can be found in fruits, beans, and bran cereals like apples, bananas, lentils,chickpeas,oats, sweet potato etc.

For most kids, measles protection is part of the measles-mumps-rubella vaccine (MMR)or measles-mumps-rubella-varicella vaccine (MMRV) given when they're 12 to 15 months old and again when they're 4 to 6 years old.
